security_audit.summary: After detailed analysis, this is a legitimate AI learning companion skill. All static findings are false positives: backticks are documentation examples, cryptographic patterns are benign tech lists, hidden file access is standard Claude Code skill storage, and SQLite/ChromaDB operations are intended local persistence. No malicious intent or credential exfiltration detected.

content.value_statement: An AI learning partner that remembers your notes and conversations across projects. It provides personalized responses by analyzing your learning patterns, emotions, and history using vector embeddings.
actual_capabilities: Automatically processes and vectorizes learning notes using BAAI/bge-m3 embeddings
Stores conversation history with importance scoring and semantic retrieval
Tracks learning emotions and thinking levels for personalized responses
Generates hierarchical tags for notes, conversations, and code snippets
Provides multi-source retrieval across notes, conversations, and code
limitations: Requires Python 3.8+ with virtual environment setup
First run downloads ~4.3GB embedding model from Hugging Face
All data stored locally in Claude Code skills directory
Relies on user creating notes directory and configuration files

use_cases.title: Personal coding mentor
use_cases.description: Remembers your learning progress and provides context-aware coding assistance across projects

use_cases.title: AI study companion
use_cases.description: Tracks study notes and conversations to help build long-term knowledge retention

use_cases.title: Knowledge synthesis tool
use_cases.description: Organizes research notes and retrieves relevant past discussions automatically

prompt_templates.title: Add learning note
prompt_templates.prompt: Process my new note at notes/react-learning.md and add it to my knowledge base

prompt_templates.title: Recall past context
prompt_templates.prompt: What did we discuss last week about React hooks and state management?

prompt_templates.title: Generate report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a weekly learning report showing my progress and knowledge gaps

prompt_templates.title: Cross-project query
prompt_templates.prompt: Search all my notes and conversations about error handling patterns I've learned

output: ğŸ’¾ Indexed 3 chunks to vector database

output_examples.input: What do you know about my React learning?
output: ğŸ” Found 5 relevant entries from your notes and conversations
ğŸ“ You learned React hooks 2 weeks ago (Level 3 thinking)
ğŸ’¬ We discussed useState and useEffect patterns
ğŸ’¡ Current emotion: consolidation - you're building on existing knowledge

best_practices: Create detailed notes with code examples for better retrieval
Update user-persona.md with your learning background for personalized responses
Review weekly reports to track your learning progress and identify gaps
anti_patterns: Don't expect instant answers without context - the skill needs time to index your notes
Avoid storing sensitive information in notes as all content is persisted locally
Don't skip the persona configuration - it significantly affects response quality

faq.question: How much storage does this skill use?
faq.answer: The embedding model is ~4.3GB cached. Each chunk uses ~5KB. 1000 chunks is about 5MB.

faq.question: Can I use this across multiple projects?
faq.answer: Yes, the vector database is centralized in the skill directory. All projects share the same long-term memory.

faq.question: Is my data secure?
faq.answer: All data is stored locally in ~/.claude/skills/ai-partner-chat/data/. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: What happens to my data during updates?
faq.answer: The install script automatically backs up and restores your data directory during reinstallation.

faq.question: Which embedding model is used?
faq.answer: BAAI/bge-m3, a 1024-dimensional multilingual model optimized for semantic understanding.

faq.question: Can I customize the tag taxonomy?
faq.answer: Yes, create config/tags_taxonomy.json with your custom topic, tech, and domain tags.
